cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 165 miles SE of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across Cuba today, then north-northwest near the Florida Keys tonight, up the west coast of Florida Tuesday–Wednesday, and turning northeast along the coastal Southeast toward the Mid-Atlantic late Thursday–Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west coast of Florida near the Big Bend/Tampa Bay area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Florida Keys east of Craig Key to Ocean Reef, Florida Bay, and the west coast of Florida from Englewood northward to the Aucilla River; Cuban province of Artemisa
weather_observation.warning_coast: Cuban provinces Camaguey, Ciego de Avila, Sancti Spiritus, Villa Clara, Mayabeque & Havana; Florida Keys Craig Key westward to Dry Tortugas; west coast of Florida Flamingo to Englewood
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida peninsula west coast, coastal Georgia, South Carolina, North Carolina, and Mid-Atlantic including southeastern Virginia
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤10%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds late Thursday; gusts to 30–35 mph possible
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Virginia coast based on current guidance
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could bring 1–3 inches with localized 4 inches Thursday–Friday, causing ponding and minor flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief isolated tornadoes possible in outer rainbands; short-period rough seas in Chesapeake Bay
